description: Prairie camas (Camassia angusta) is an amazing plant species native to North America. A member of the asparagus family, this semi-evergreen perennial flower stands out with its bright, six-petal blooms that often resemble stars. Its tall stems are bulb-shaped and range in colors from pale blue to violet. Not only beautiful, prairie camas is also a valued food source for pollinators and other wildlife. It's often found in meadows, often thriving in drier, sunnier climates than many of its prairie perennial relatives. Prairie camas is easy to maintain and is a great addition to any native/wildflower garden.
